title: S1 Ep58: Families as social institutions
itunes:title: Families as social institutions
description: When economists talk about the "household", they usually mean a family. But Natalie Bau and Raquel Fernandez tell Tim Phillips that there are many types of family, with many cultural traditions and habits, and these differences can have a big impact on whether well-meaning attempts to improve their lives will succeed or fail.
itunes:author: VoxDev.org
dc:creator: VoxDev.org
